abstract.p: Calendar of food-related happenings in New York (S)

block.p: In conjunction with ''Paris in New York: French Jewish Artists in Private Collections,'' an exhibition running through June 25 at the Jewish Museum, a new kosher steakhouse in the financial district, Le Marais 2 (15 John Street, at Broadway), is giving each patron who has a receipt for museum admission a 25 percent discount on an appetizer, a main course and a dessert. And those who dine at the steakhouse will get a half-price admission to the exhibition.

Niles Eldredge, the curator of the Hall of Biodiversity at the American Museum of Natural History, will be the speaker at a dinner on Tuesday at 7 p.m. at Savoy, 70 Prince Street (Crosby Street). The menu will illustrate various forms of life in food, from the penicillium bacteria in blue-cheese fritters, to fungi like porcini mushrooms, to seaweed in a salad, and on up the food chain to a suckling pig. The fee is $85, including wine. Reservations: (212) 219-8570.

A culinary walking tour of the Russian markets and restaurants in the Brighton Beach district of Brooklyn will be conducted on Monday, from 6 to 9 p.m., by the Culinary Arts program of the New School. The fee, $60, includes dinner. Reservations: (212) 255-4141.
